title: Manager, People Operations
content:
About Remote
Remote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance. Check out remote.com/how-it-works to learn more or if you’re interested in adding to the mission, scroll down to apply now.
Please take a look at remote.com/handbook to learn more about our culture and what it is like to work here. Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age and abilities to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. You can check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor or look up the results of our candidate surveys to see how others feel about working and interviewing here.
All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!The position
The Manager, People Operations role is responsible for managing our People Operations at Remote. This role’s focus will be to help with the implementation and execution of strategies that help support and enable a high performance culture in a global, fully remote environment. This area of our People Enablement Team helps to drive efficient and scalable processes and policies, leads our HR systems and helps to build and scale our people analytics while fostering a culture of innovation. This role will be crucial in aligning and leveling up our Remoters’ experience through People processes, policies and analytics with Remote’s values, goals, and mission in mind.
Key responsibilities

Lead, develop and motivate a team that consists of People Operations Associates and Specialists who are focused on ensuring operational excellence and a seamless employee experience
Partner cross-functionally with different stakeholders on objectives, this includes People Programs, Learning and Development, People Partners and Talent Acquisition
Contribute and support initiatives that foster employee development and organizational growth that include talent development, performance management, DEIB, skills enablement and learning programs
Develop and implement strategies that help create efficiencies by effectively leveraging our tech stack, driving process optimization and automation, appropriately prioritizing workload distribution across the team and building data reporting and analytics in a scalable, efficient way for the organization
Determine team goals with key measurable indicators that are aligned to strategic objectives while also driving goal tracking and attainment by the team with clear indicators of success
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and execute on operational best practices that support increasing team productivity while also support a seamless, valuable employee experience
Manage our HR information system (HRIS), overseeing data integrity and system functionality while driving automation and identifying areas for efficiency
Act as an escalation point for the team, providing guidance on HR policies, processes and procedures.
Act as an advocate for remote working, Remote’s values and DEI, ensuring these are experienced throughout the employee experience.
Assess and optimize existing People processes, policies, and programs to ensure sustainability and scalability as we grow. Recommend and implement process improvements to streamline operations and enhance efficiency.

Requirements

5+ years experience within People Operations roles in fast paced environments, with at least 1 year of experience managing a team.
In-depth understanding of People Operations processes, policies, technology tools and data analysis along with general knowledge and understanding of holistic HR and talent practices
Strong collaboration skills working cross functionally with various different functional departments to improve processes and gain efficiencies
Ability to align People processes and policies with company values, goals, and mission. Strong strategic thinking skills to drive sustainable and scalable solutions.
Excellent leadership skills with the ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to engage and inspire others.
Demonstrated track record of fostering innovation and promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in an organization. Proven ability to introduce and implement creative solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions. Proven ability to handle complex employee relations issues with discretion and sensitivity.
Proven organizational skills with attention to detail and ability to drive initiatives forward with clear direction and purpose
Writes and speaks fluent English.
It's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus

Practicals

You'll report to: Senior Manager, People Enablement
Department: People Department
Location: Anywhere in the world
Start date: As soon as possible

Application process

(async) Profile review
Interview with recruiter
Interview with Senior Manager, People Enablement
Interview with team members (no managers present)
Interview with Director, People Enablement
(async) Offer

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhere
unlimited personal time off (minimum 4 weeks)
quarterly company-wide day off for self care
flexible working hours (we are async)
16 weeks paid parental leave
mental health support services
stock options
learning budget
home office budget & IT equipment
budget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How you’ll plan your day (and life)
We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.
You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.
If that sounds like something you want, apply now!
How to apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.
We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.
If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.
Need help? Email hiring@remote.com

demographic_questions.description:
Voluntary Self-Identification

Remote is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and as such it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Through the below self-identification survey, we invite you to share your demographic information. 

This information will be used to ensure that our hiring process is inclusive and that people of all backgrounds are represented in our talent pool.

All answers are anonymous and will not be tied to your job application or candidate profile. The data will be aggregated and only used to inform our hiring strategies and processes to ensure we are actively working toward creating access to opportunities among under-represented groups and increasing our teams’ diversity.

These questions are optional and voluntary, and will not have any impact on hiring outcomes.

Visit the Remote Handbook to read more about how diversity, equity, and inclusion are a way of life at Remote.

answer_options.label: Hispanic or Latino: A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.
White (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.
Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.

Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Th
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.

American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.
Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino): Persons who identify with two or more race categories named above.

questions.label: What gender do you identify with?
Do you identify as part of the Lesbian, Bisexual, Gay, Transgender, Queer, Intersex, and Asexual (LBGTQIA+) community?
Do you consider yourself to have a disability?
Do you have a non-compete in place with your previous or current employer that prevents you from working for us?

questions.description:
When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Remote, which consists in a network of legal entities. However, for data protection purposes the entities in control of all personal data processed in connection with your application are:

  • Remote Europe Holding, B.V., a company registered in the Netherlands under number 7403597 at Landmeter 25, 1566MP, Assendelft; and
  • Remote Technology Services, Inc., a company registered in the United States of America under number 7946800 at 1209 Orange St, Wilmington, DE 19801;

collectively referred to as 'Controller'.

Controller’s data protection is handled by our Data Protection Officer, who can be contacted at dpo@remote.com. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing the Controller’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation - GDPR) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.

Your personal data will be stored with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the USA and engaged by the Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on the Controller’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this website. Because the European Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer (to both Greenhouse and Persona) will be subject to additional appropriate safeguards in the form of pre-approved standard contractual clauses. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at dpo@remote.com.

If your application is successful, the Controller will make an offer for employment which may be conditional on you passing a few additional checks, such as an ID verification check and employment history check. We conduct these checks via Veremark Ltd (United Kingdom) and Persona Identities, Inc. (USA). You will receive an additional notice if and when the Controller requires these checks.

Your personal data will be retained by the Controller as long as the Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your suitability for the role you are applying for, but in any event for no longer than a year. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data is restricted. You also have the right to data portability and the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection authority.
questions.label: Privacy notice
How did you hear about Remote?
Please choose the country in which you are located.
Work eligibility is extremely important. Are you legally eligible to work in the country where you’re planning to work from?
If you are eligible, please select the status that allows you to work and live in that Country:

values.label: I am a Citizen/Permanent Resident of the Country where I plan to live and work from
I have a Work VISA in the Country where I plan to live and work from
I require Sponsorship from Remote in the Country where I plan to live and work from
I'm a refugee and require assistance with sponsorship in the country I would like to live in

questions.label: What pronouns should we use to refer to you?

At Remote, we are committed to transparency, innovation, and care for our employees and candidates. To support this and ensure we are able to focus on you, not on taking notes, we use brighthire.ai to record and auto-transcript our interviews. If we decide you are good potential fit for the role, do you consent to us using this tool during your first interview? Declining recording will not affect your candidacy.
